title: Does it makes sense to offer writers equity share in a company? - Quora

response.answer_text: Offering equity is a way of paying people without money, by stealing from shareholders. It makes sense, I just don't think it is ethical. I should say, it is less ethical in my mind when you give it to people internal to the organization, but even with outsiders, it's a weird system of rewards, it's like printing your own money, it's kind of hard to evaluate the reward, and it creates unclear incentives. I don't know, I have a knee-jerk reaction against it from past experience.

I know of some existing models of compensating for content.But honestly? It has to be a combination of two things:1. Rev share - Find a way to make SOME profit of the website, and give contributors a worthy cut.2. Experience/Exposure - Find a way to empower the contributors that allows them to benefit professionally from quality content they write. Drop the equity angle - It's not sensible cost effective wise, neither to them nor you.
It seems eminently reasonable to me to reward any employee for key contributions with equity.
It might if you are in the publication business.
